input.description: XML document conforming to the ConnectionDetails Concept that contains the information required to execute a command.
The messaging name to be added to the messenger service.

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation succeed? Valid values: true

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo Command not supported on Linux.</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo Command not supported on SunOS.</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">net name </xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${messaging name}')!=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${messaging name}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${messaging name}')!=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> /add</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Create Messaging Name Creates a messaging name (that is, an alias), for which the computer can accept messages.
